title: Quality script
content:
Any suggestions for a clean quality script font for a wedding program?  
Thanks,  
Lori Greig

 [‹ Student Newspaper Redesign](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47872 "Go to previous forum topic") [Good font software... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48353 "Go to next forum topic")
author: watercolor8

comments.content:
[Bickham Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/bickham_script_pro_ot_virtual/) is still my favorite.  
On the more formal, _sloopy_ end is [Sloop](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/sloop/).
When my wife and I got married, we put our wedding invitations together using [Adine Kirnberg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.dafont.com/adine-kirnberg.font).

I just did a wedding invitation for a friend using Feel Script.

[http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000300](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000300 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000300")
Tell us about the bride and groom (or bride and bride, groom and groom) what kind of thing do they like, where is the wedding taking place?

Take a look at the recently released Biscotti: [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Biscotti](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122064549/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Biscotti "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Biscotti")

<cite> > Biscotti was commissioned in 2004 by Gretchen Smelter and Donna Adjerian for Brides magazine. “We want a typeface that makes the reader feel pretty; it should capture the voice of this happy occasion.”</cite>

What bride doesn’t want to feel pretty on this happy occasion? :-)
